subject: Re: [junit] Inner class TestCase Doesn't Seem to Work
msgSnippet: So said  bcr19374   on  12/30/2002 ... Your inner class is not a static inner class, so you need an instance of the outer class to create
messageBody:
So said bcr19374 <bcr19374@...> on 12/30/2002
--------------------

>I wanted to make an inner class be a TestCase, but when I try to run
>jUnit I get an assertion failed saying it has no public constructor
>for TestCase. I've uploaded a file to the files section called
>TestTest.java which is demonstrates this problem.

Your inner class is not a static inner class, so you need an instance
of the outer class to create an instance of the inner class. I suggest
you change your inner class to a static inner class.

Good luck.
